column4: just trying to set up wireless. when I input iwconfig, I am told that wlan0 power is off. how do I, er, switch it on?:)
ifconfig or ifup, or use gnome network-manager.
but be aware, ifconfig and ifup use different lock files, so if you use both, you can get quite confused.
I see. am using xubuntu but that channel is dead. guess it's time for some heavy googling
Er, not different lock files, but different files to store the current state. So if you turn wlan0 off with ifdown, then try to turn it on with ifconfig, it'll tell you it's already on.
I'm more of a shell guy, but most people seem to use the gnome network manager appet.
It should be up in your menu bar, usually near the right corner in vanilla ubuntu, and it looks like either a cell phone signal bars indicator (when connected) or like two overlapping PC icons.
sudo ifconfig -a should show you all of the current details.
With ifconfig, ti'd be "sudo ifconfig eth1 up" or "Sudo ifconfig eth1 down".
or "sudo ifup eth1" and "sudo ifdown eth1"
